description:
Build with virtual parts, render designs and create instructions.

Studio is an all-in-one desktop app for Windows and Mac that lets you build with virtual parts, render designs and create instructions.

What can I do with Studio?
Build
You can build your own virtual creations! Start a project from scratch, import a saved LEGOÂ® Digital Designer file, upload a picture to make a mosaic, or just use your imagination and see what happens when you put the pieces together.
Test a design
By testing your design, you can find out if it can be built with real LEGO bricks.
Create or browse instructions
Use Instruction Maker to create step-by-step instructions for your designs
Render designs
Generate photorealistic images and short videos of your designs
Share on the Studio Gallery
Upload your designs on My Studio and publish them on Studio Gallery
Use the BrickLink catalog
Check if the parts in your design are available and how much they cost.
Fixed a bug where locking a page in Instruction maker in one project affected locked pages in other open projects.
Fixed case-sensitivity issue when matching custom parts to missing parts while importing a set.
Spelling for Orthognal View updated in the tooltips.
Fixed a bug where part outlines did not move when user uses select by connect and splits and merges parts.
Fixed a bug where, after a user cloned a submodel and changed its color, using Undo would revert the color to the current color.
Fixed a bug that caused embedded custom part decals to be lost upon opening instruction mode.
Fixed an issue where Eyesight render had blurry textures or decals randomly.
Fixed a graphical glitch in the Step Editor.
Fixed the multi-connect tool not properly aligning the part rotation.
Fixed stability simulator reverting the visual state when changing back to stability mode.
Fixed an issue where using the hinge tool caused too many parts to be rotated and selected.
Fixed an issue where Studio silently crashed when saving after using the page editor in the Instruction Maker.
Fixed an issue where a previous patch broke the executable permission on macOS.
Fixed an issue where users were unable to delete images or text using the Delete key or the Delete option in the context menu.
